job.title: Machine Learning Engineer
job.description: Knock is on a mission to empower people to move freely. The Knock Home Swap™ makes it easy for consumers to buy their new home before selling their old one, skipping the hassles of living through repairs and showings, paying only one mortgage at a time, and having home prep covered upfront so their old house sells for the highest possible price. Knock currently offers the Home Swap in 34 markets in nine states and counting. Launched in 2015 by founding team members of Trulia.com , Knock has raised more than $600 million in debt and equity from top tier investors, including RRE Ventures, Foundry Group, Redpoint, Greycroft, Corazon Capital, Correlation Ventures, Great Oaks Venture Capital and FJ Labs. Enjoying Life & Making an Impact Knock is a 100% remote, work from home culture and has been since our inception in 2015 100% employee covered medical, dental, & vision premiums Unlimited PTO (2 week min. is highly encouraged) + flexible work schedules $1,000 each year for professional development Salary + Equity. We offer equitable compensation based on market data, your experience & geographic location Paid parental leave We believe in creating diverse, equitable, and inclusive practices and programs that will further Knock’s commitment to making an impact, learning, putting people first, being open, and courageous Machine Learning Engineer: We’d love you to bring: Currently enrolled in or have completed a Master’s or Ph.D. program in a relevant field Candidates about to complete a Bachelor’s degree will be considered with demonstrated ML experience Programming experience in Python and Tensorflow/PyTorchExperience building ML solutions and experimenting to improve ML system performance A desire to build cool cutting edge ML tech Strong understanding of probability and machine learning Self-motivation, and ability to work independently as well as with a remote team Belief in creating diverse, equitable, and inclusive practices and programs that will further Knock’s commitment to making an impact, learning, putting people first, being open, and courageous We encourage you to apply even if you don’t have every listed requirement Knock is a 100% remote, work from home culture and has been since our inception in 2015 As a Machine Learning Engineer, your journey will look like this: Week 1: you will begin learning about our machine learning models. Week 2: you will have a reasonably scoped machine learning project to dive into, enabling you to demonstrate your skills and have an impact immediately. During your journey, you’ll have an opportunity to engage with not only other machine learning engineers and data scientists, but also members of the engineering and product teams. In the process, you’ll gain a better understanding of how our pricing models impact Knock’s operations and ultimately the customer. You will have access to all our data and AWS computing resources to query, explore, and train models using the data using any programming language and packages you feel you prefer. But most importantly, you’ll have the time and space to experiment, read academic literature, develop new skills, and learn about existing methodologies that may contribute to advancing Knock’s machine learning technology! We are proud to be a distributed company from our founding with employees in 28 states and counting. This is an amazing opportunity to be an integral part of building a multi-billion dollar consumer brand in an industry that is long overdue for a new way of doing things. You will be working with a passionate team that is disrupting the status quo. Knock, and its subsidiaries, are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, and equitable environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Please no recruitment firm or agency inquiries, you will not receive a reply from us. This position is in the continental United States. PDF is our preferred format for resumes and any other attachments. Thank you!
